sen.j: 行表（ぎょうひょう、養老6年（722年） - 延暦16年2月（797年））は奈良時代の僧。
sen.e: Gyohyo (722 - 797) was a priest during the Nara period.
Gyohyo (722 - 797) was a Buddhist priest who lived in the Nara period.
Gyohyo (722 - 797) was a Buddhist priest who lived in the Nara period.

sen.j: 大和国葛上郡高宮郷の出身。
sen.e: Born in Takamiya Hamlet, Katsujo County, Yamato Province
He was born in Takamiya-go, Katsuragi no kami no kori (or Katsujo-gun) County, Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 表現・用語を修正しました
sen.e: He was born in Takamiya-go, Katsuragi no kami no kori (or Katsujo-gun) County, Yamato Province.

sen.j: 父は檜前（ひのくま）調使案麻呂。
sen.e: His father, Choshikuramigagi HINOKUMA.
His father was Choshikuramigaki HINOKUMA.
His father was Choshikuramigaki HINOKUMA.
Gyohyo was commonly referred to as `hyakko` (lit. one hundred houses).
His secular name was Hyakko.
His secular name was Hyakko.

sen.j: 741年（天平13年）恭仁宮で道璿に師事して得度し、743年（天平15年）興福寺北倉院で受戒。
sen.e: In 741 at Ninomiya (site of the ancient capital in the Nara period) he became a monk and studied under the Chinese priest Daoxuan (Japanese transliteration: Dosen) and took his vows at Kofuku-ji temple in the Kitakura imperial palace.

In 741, at Kuninomiya (alternatively read Kunikyo, site of the ancient capital in the Nara period) he studied under the Chinese priest Daoxuan (Japanese transliteration: Dosen) and entered the Buddhist priesthood, taking his vows at Hokuso-in of the Kofuku-ji Temple in 743.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: In 741, at Kuninomiya (alternatively read Kunikyo, site of the ancient capital in the Nara period) he studied under the Chinese priest Daoxuan (Japanese transliteration: Dosen) and entered the Buddhist priesthood, taking his vows at Hokuso-in of the Kofuku-ji Temple in 743.

sen.j: 興福寺で禅・唯識を学ぶ。
sen.e: At Kofuku-ji he studied Zen and vijnapti-matrata (theory that all existence is subjective and nothing exists outside of the mind).
At the Kofuku-ji Temple he studied Zen and vijnapti-matra (aka yuishiki or consciousness-only, a theory that all existence is subjective and nothing exists outside of the mind).
sen.cmt: 形式を修正し、用語を補足しました
sen.e: At the Kofuku-ji Temple he studied Zen and vijnapti-matra (aka yuishiki or consciousness-only, a theory that all existence is subjective and nothing exists outside of the mind).

sen.j: その後、近江国崇福寺 (大津市)の寺主となり1丈余りの千手観音菩薩を造り、次いで近江国の大国師となった。
sen.e: Subsequently at Sufuku-ji temple in Omi Province (Otsu City) he became head monk and had a large statue of the thousand-armed Goddess of Mercy made and then became the head priest in Omi Province.

Subsequently, at Sufuku-ji Temple in Omi Province (Otsu City) he became jishu (director of a temple) and had a large statue of the thousand-armed Goddess of Mercy of about 3.03 meters tall made, and then became daikokushi (greater provincial teacher) of Omi Province.

sen.j: 778年（宝亀9年）最澄の師となり、780年（宝亀11年）師主として最澄を得度させている。
sen.e: In 778 he taught the Saicho and in 780 had Saicho take his vows.
In 778, he taught Saicho and in 780, as shishu (master) he had Saicho take his vows.

sen.e: In 778, he taught Saicho and in 780, as shishu (master) he had Saicho take his vows.

sen.j: 後奈良大安寺に移った。
sen.e: He transferred to Daian-ji temple in Gonara.
